results.title: Flight to the planets
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Space Science”.
Examines both the principles that govern flight to the planets and the gravitational pull of each of the nine planets of our solar system.

results.title: Orbital shapes and paths
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Space Science”.
How is a satellite placed in a desired orbit? The program explores this problem by illustrating how a satellite’s shape, path and period may be modified. Practical application of this procedure - the establishing of weather and communications satellites - is demonstrated as students are given a satellite’s eye view of the various paths over the earth’s surface.

results.title: Behind the veil: nuns. Pt. 1.
results.creator_credit: Margaret Wescott, Kathleen Shannon, Signe Johansson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Part 1 of an in depth look at the history and influence of the largest all female, communal organisation in the world. The film spans the twenty centuries since Jesus’ birth as well as the pre-Christian-climates from which Christianity has evolved. Contemporary nuns of strength, dignity and commitment speak of their lives and of their predecessors. Filmed in Ireland, Canada, the United States and Italy, Part 1 contrasts the experiences of contemporary active nuns, living and working amidst poverty and crime, with the story of a young woman whose search for spirituality led her to a monastery near Rome. The film explores some of the roots of the paternalistic attitudes that have dominated the Catholic Church almost since its inception and the resultant denigration and sometimes persecution of religious women. Part 1 ends with contemporary nuns voicing their feelings about love and sexuality.

results.title: The Plains of Heaven
results.brief_description: In this inversion of the buddy-film two technicians manning a tracking station on the High Plains pursue diametrically opposed ways of coping with the isolation. The ageing Cunningham seems to be rejuvenated by and obsessed with the landscape while the younger Barker withdraws into the station and its attendant technology. Return to Barker’s Melbourne becomes a descent into a fragmented, nightmare cityscape. The denial of cause and effect explanations for behaviour invites a metaphysical interpretation of this ambiguously down-side existential drama of disorientation and alienation not dissimilar to Werner Herzog’s visionary dramas although without the German director’s quirky black humour. Cast: Richard Moir, Reg Evans, Gerard Kennedy.

results.title: Integrated Alternative Health Care
results.brief_description: We are shown the full range of medical and educational programs with their new approach to integrated care, which has also been called alternative medicine. The film focuses on the role of paramedics and on their education and their motivation.

results.title: The Unorganised manager. Part I. Damnation (NP)
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of time management and delegation techniques. “Damnation” shows Richard Lewis, an unorganised manager, doing jobs he need not do, wasting his time and the time of others. He becomes so stressed he suffers a coronary. Cast includes John Cleese, James Bolan. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: The Lost babies
results.brief_description: A documentary about the tragedy of babies who are either stillborn or who die very soon after birth and the emotional consequences for the parents. Parents who have experienced the death of their baby discuss their reactions and specialists talk about how they can help the parents through the grieving process.

results.title: Alexander and the car with a missing headlight
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Freitag, Peter Fleischmann, Institut für Film und Bild and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Released by the Weston Woods Studios in 1966 and English language version directed by Cynthia Freitag. A fantasy about a small boy’s adventures as he drives around the world in an old car. Pictures, sound effects and narrative comments are by children of different nations. From the book by Peter Fleischmann and Morton Schindel. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: Fourteen rats and a ratcatcher
results.creator_credit: Francesco Tenze, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: There is inevitable conflict between an old woman and a family of rats living under the same roof. A deal is struck when the old woman brings in a ratcatcher. Based on the book by James Cressy and Jamasin Cole.

results.title: The Snowman
results.creator_credit: Dianne Jackson, John Coates and Snowman Enterprises
results.brief_description: A young boy dreams that his snowman comes to life. Together they share the perils and joys of winter. This animated film uses muted pastels coupled with an exquisite orchestral score to make this non-verbal Christmas tale an experience for all seasons. Based on the book by Raymond Briggs.
